overview_of_class:
Modeling the dynamic behavior of physical systems. Concepts of causality, dependent and independent storages, and state. Introduction to bond graphs. Generation of state equations; analytical and computer simulation of system behavior. Application to problems of engineering interest.



Who takes it

Juniors and seniors in Mechanical Engineering take this course. Many first year graduate students in Mechanical Engineering and Biomedical Engineering also take it. Many students take ME 390 to become familiar with dynamic analysis and to prepare for EECS 390, Feedback control systems.
name: Intro to Dynamic Systems
